org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.transformer.trimming

Class TrimmingFunction

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.magicdgs.readtools.utils.read.transformer.trimming.TrimmingFunction
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.util.function.Function<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>, java.util.function.UnaryOperator<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>, org.broadinstitute.hellbender.transformers.ReadTransformer, org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.SerializableFunction<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    CutReadTrimmer, MottQualityTrimmer, TrailingNtrimmer

    public abstract class TrimmingFunction
extends java.lang.Object
implements org.broadinstitute.hellbender.transformers.ReadTransformer, java.io.Serializable
    Trimming function is a especial ReadTransformer that updates in-place the trimming tags on a read passed to it. If the read is already trimmed, the function will not be applied in the default implementation.
    See Also:
    RTReadUtils.updateCompletelyTrimReadFlag(GATKRead), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingPointTags(GATKRead, int, int), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingStartPointTag(GATKRead, int), RTReadUtils.updateTrimmingEndPointTag(GATKRead, int), ReservedTags.ts, ReservedTags.te, Serialized Form

    • Method Detail

      • apply

        public final org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead apply(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read)
        Update and check if the read is already trimmed, and if so it skips the trimming. Otherwise, it gets the trimming points from fillTrimPoints(GATKRead, int[]) and apply then to the reads. Note: the read is updated in-place and returned.
        Specified by:
        apply in interface java.util.function.Function<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>
        Specified by:
        apply in interface org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.SerializableFunction<org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead,org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead>

      • canSetDisableEnds

        public final boolean canSetDisableEnds()
        Check if it is safe to use setDisableEnds(boolean, boolean). They cannot be set if: - It was already set. - The function was already applied.
        Returns:
        true if setDisableEnds(boolean, boolean) can be called; false otherwise.

      • setDisableEnds

        public final void setDisableEnds(boolean disable5prime,
                                 boolean disable3prime)
        Sets if some end should be disabled. Note: this should be used before any other public method is called except isDisable3prime() or isDisable5prime().
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if canSetDisableEnds() returns false.
        See Also:
        canSetDisableEnds()

      • isDisable5prime

        public final boolean isDisable5prime()
        If true, this trimmer does not trim the 5 prime of the read.

      • isDisable3prime

        public final boolean isDisable3prime()
        If true, does not trim the 3 prime of the read.

      • fillTrimPoints

        protected abstract void fillTrimPoints(org.broadinstitute.hellbender.utils.read.GATKRead read,
                                       int[] toFill)
        Gets the trimming points for applying this trimmer. If one end is not trimmed, it does not require to update that index.
        Parameters:
        read - the read to use for getting the trimming points. It should not be modified.
        toFill - array of length 2, to fill in the trimming points. Index 0 should have the first and index 1 the second.

      • validateArgsUnsafe

        public void validateArgsUnsafe()
        Unsafe validation of arguments (may change if setDisableEnds(boolean, boolean) is called, which throws a command line exception or user exception depending on the implementation. For a safe validation, use validateArgs(). WARNING: use only if a validation is required before calling setDisableEnds(boolean, boolean) Default behaviour does not perform any validation. Implementations should verify that their arguments are compatible with isDisable5prime() and/or isDisable3prime().
        Throws:
        org.broadinstitute.barclay.argparser.CommandLineException - if arguments are invalid.
        org.broadinstitute.hellbender.exceptions.UserException - if arguments are invalid.

      • validateArgs

        public final void validateArgs()
        Validates the arguments and throws a command line exception or user exception if the arguments are invalid.
        Throws:
        org.broadinstitute.barclay.argparser.CommandLineException - if arguments are invalid.
        org.broadinstitute.hellbender.exceptions.UserException - if arguments are invalid.
